title: Hooded figure runs across the front lawn of a suburban home in Oakburst and fires twice
text:
Neighbours living in a quiet cul-de-sac have said they are living in fear after a hooded gunman fired repeatedly into a family home on Saturday night.

The unknown shooter fired a shotgun twice into a home in Oakhurst, Western Sydney, late on Saturday night, while a mother and her four children were inside.

Shocking footage shows the person approach on foot, dressed in a tracksuit with the hood up and firing at the house twice before running away, with the barrel of the gun glowing hot in the dead of night.

Incredibly, it is the second time this year the home has been attacked after police were called to the scene back in May.

As police investigated the scene on Sunday morning, large chunks off the face of the home were seen blown off by the shots as neighbours said they were left frightened by the ordeal.

'It sounded like an explosion, like a bomb going off - it was scary, put it that way,' one neighbour told Seven News.

Thankfully no one was injured in the shooting and police are now trying to find the person responsible.

One woman said she was suddenly awoken by voices and noises outside her house.

The unknown shooter fired a shotgun twice into the Oakhurst home in Western Sydney with a mother and her four children inside and blowing holes in the home (pictured)

'They said "quickly go and start the car, quickly quickly" and then after they left I stood up and said "what the hell is going on?"'

The neighbour is among many who said they are tired of the violence on their street.

'We have got kids here living as well, so you know... it's very difficult to live in fear,' he said.

If you have any information please contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
description: The unknown figure fired a shotgun twice into the Oakhurst home in Western Sydney late Saturday night with a mother and her four children inside.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
